name: Subscription
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription
description:
Subscription

A named resource representing the stream of messages from a single, specific Topic, to be delivered to the subscribing application.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
msgs = sub.pull
msgs.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

methods.name: topic
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#topic
methods.description: The Topic from which this subscription receives messages.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.topic.name #=> "projects/my-project/topics/my-topic"

methods.name: deadline
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#deadline
methods.description: This value is the maximum number of seconds after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message.

methods.name: retain_acked
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#retain_acked
methods.description: Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages. If true, then messages are not expunged from the subscription’s backlog, even if they are acknowledged, until they fall out of the #retention_duration window. Default is false.

returns.description: Returns true if acknowledged messages are retained.

methods.name: retention
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#retention
methods.description: How long to retain unacknowledged messages in the subscription’s backlog, from the moment a message is published. If #retain_acked is true, then this also configures the retention of acknowledged messages, and thus configures how far back in time a #seek can be done. Cannot be more than 604,800 seconds (7 days) or less than 600 seconds (10 minutes). Default is 604,800 seconds (7 days).

returns.description: The message retention duration in seconds.

methods.name: endpoint
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#endpoint
methods.description: Returns the URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed.

methods.name: endpoint=
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#endpoint=
methods.description: Sets the URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed.

methods.name: exists?
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#exists?
methods.description: Determines whether the subscription exists in the Pub/Sub service.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.exists? #=> true

methods.name: delete
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#delete
methods.description: Deletes an existing subscription. All pending messages in the subscription are immediately dropped.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the subscription was deleted.

methods.name: pull
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#pull
methods.description: Pulls messages from the server. Returns an empty list if there are no messages available in the backlog. Raises an ApiError with status UNAVAILABLE if there are too many concurrent pull requests pending for the given subscription.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.pull.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

examples.caption: A maximum number of messages returned can also be specified:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.pull(max: 10).each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

examples.caption: The call can block until messages are available:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
msgs = sub.pull immediate: false
msgs.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

params.name: immediate
params.description: When true the system will respond immediately even if it is not able to return messages. When false the system is allowed to wait until it can return least one message. No messages are returned when a request times out. The default value is true.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum number of messages to return for this request. The Pub/Sub system may return fewer than the number specified. The default value is 100, the maximum value is 1000.

methods.name: wait_for_messages
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#wait_for_messages
methods.description:
Pulls from the server while waiting for messages to become available. This is the same as:

subscription.pull immediate: false

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
msgs = sub.wait_for_messages
msgs.each { |msg| msg.acknowledge! }

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum number of messages to return for this request. The Pub/Sub system may return fewer than the number specified. The default value is 100, the maximum value is 1000.

methods.name: listen
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#listen
methods.description: Create a Subscriber object that receives and processes messages using the code provided in the callback.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"

subscriber = sub.listen do |msg|
  # process msg
  msg.ack!
end

subscriber.start

# Shut down the subscriber when ready to stop receiving messages.
subscriber.stop.wait!

examples.caption: Configuring to increase concurrent callbacks:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"

subscriber = sub.listen threads: { callback: 16 } do |msg|
  # store the message somewhere before acknowledging
  store_in_backend msg.data # takes a few seconds
  msg.ack!
end

subscriber.start

params.name: deadline
params.description: The default number of seconds the stream will hold received messages before modifying the message’s ack deadline. The minimum is 10, the maximum is 600. Default is #deadline. Optional.

params.name: streams
params.description:
The number of concurrent streams to open to
pull messages from the subscription. Default is 4. Optional.

params.name: inventory
params.description:
The number of received messages to be
collected by subscriber. Default is 1,000. Optional.

params.name: threads
params.description:
The number of threads to create to handle concurrent calls by each stream opened by the subscriber. Optional.

Hash keys and values may include the following:

  • :callback (Integer) The number of threads used to handle the received messages. Default is 8.
  • :push (Integer) The number of threads to handle acknowledgement (ReceivedMessage#ack!) and delay messages (ReceivedMessage#nack!, ReceivedMessage#delay!). Default is 4.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for processing new messages

methods.name: acknowledge
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#acknowledge
methods.description: Acknowledges receipt of a message. After an ack, the Pub/Sub system can remove the message from the subscription. Acknowledging a message whose ack deadline has expired may succeed, although the message may have been sent again. Acknowledging a message more than once will not result in an error. This is only used for messages received via pull.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
messages = sub.pull
sub.acknowledge messages

params.name: messages
params.description: One or more ReceivedMessage objects or ack_id values.

methods.name: delay
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#delay
methods.description:
Modifies the acknowledge deadline for messages.

This indicates that more time is needed to process the messages, or to make the messages available for redelivery if the processing was interrupted.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
messages = sub.pull
sub.delay 120, messages

params.name: new_deadline
params.description: The new ack deadline in seconds from the time this request is sent to the Pub/Sub system. Must be >= 0. For example, if the value is 10, the new ack deadline will expire 10 seconds after the call is made. Specifying 0 may immediately make the message available for another pull request.

params.name: messages
params.description: One or more ReceivedMessage objects or ack_id values.

methods.name: create_snapshot
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#create_snapshot
methods.description:
Creates a new Snapshot from the subscription. The created snapshot is guaranteed to retain:

  • The existing backlog on the subscription. More precisely, this is defined as the messages in the subscription’s backlog that are unacknowledged upon the successful completion of the create_snapshot operation; as well as:
  • Any messages published to the subscription’s topic following the successful completion of the create_snapshot operation.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-sub"

snapshot = sub.create_snapshot "my-snapshot"
snapshot.name #=> "projects/my-project/snapshots/my-snapshot"

examples.caption: Without providing a name:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-sub"

snapshot = sub.create_snapshot
snapshot.name #=> "projects/my-project/snapshots/gcr-analysis-..."

params.name: snapshot_name
params.description: Name of the new snapshot. If the name is not provided, the server will assign a random name for this snapshot on the same project as the subscription. The format is projects/{project}/snapshots/{snap}. The name must start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9], dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus (+) or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in length, and it must not start with “goog”. Optional.

methods.name: seek
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#seek
methods.description: Resets the subscription’s backlog to a given Snapshot or to a point in time, whichever is provided in the request.

examples.caption: Using a snapshot
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-sub"

snapshot = sub.create_snapshot

messages = sub.pull
sub.acknowledge messages

sub.seek snapshot

examples.caption: Using a time:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-sub"

time = Time.now

messages = sub.pull
sub.acknowledge messages

sub.seek time

params.name: snapshot
params.description: The Snapshot instance, snapshot name, or time to which to perform the seek. If the argument is a snapshot, the snapshot’s topic must be the same as that of the subscription. If it is a time, messages retained in the subscription that were published before this time are marked as acknowledged, and messages retained in the subscription that were published after this time are marked as unacknowledged. Note that this operation affects only those messages retained in the subscription. For example, if the time corresponds to a point before the message retention window (or to a point before the system’s notion of the subscription creation time), only retained messages will be marked as unacknowledged, and already-expunged messages will not be restored.

returns.description: Returns true if the seek was successful.

methods.name: policy
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#policy
methods.description: Gets the Cloud IAM access control policy for this subscription.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"

policy = sub.policy

examples.caption: Update the policy by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"

sub.policy do |p|
  p.add "roles/owner", "user:owner@example.com"
end

params.name: yield
params.description:
A block for updating the policy. The latest policy
will be read from the Pub/Sub service and passed to the block. After
the block completes, the modified policy will be written to the
service.

params.name: yield.policy
params.description:
the current Cloud IAM Policy for this
subscription

returns.description: the current Cloud IAM Policy for this subscription

methods.name: policy=
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#policy=
methods.description:
Updates the Cloud IAM access control policy for this subscription. The policy should be read from #policy. See Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Policy for an explanation of the policy etag property and how to modify policies.

You can also update the policy by passing a block to #policy, which will call this method internally after the block completes.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"

policy = sub.policy # API call

policy.add "roles/owner", "user:owner@example.com"

sub.policy = policy # API call

params.name: new_policy
params.description:
a new or modified Cloud IAM Policy for this
subscription

returns.description: the policy returned by the API update operation

methods.name: test_permissions
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscription#test_permissions
methods.description: Tests the specified permissions against the Cloud IAM access control policy.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-subscription"
perms = sub.test_permissions "pubsub.subscriptions.get",
                             "pubsub.subscriptions.consume"
perms.include? "pubsub.subscriptions.get" #=> true
perms.include? "pubsub.subscriptions.consume" #=> false

params.name: permissions
params.description:
The set of permissions to check access for. Permissions with wildcards (such as * or storage.*) are not allowed.

The permissions that can be checked on a subscription are:

  • pubsub.subscriptions.consume
  • pubsub.subscriptions.get
  • pubsub.subscriptions.delete
  • pubsub.subscriptions.update
  • pubsub.subscriptions.getIamPolicy
  • pubsub.subscriptions.setIamPolicy
